result.execSummary:
The defendant Tywan R. Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Milwaukee Co Case 05-CF-348.  Credit for 5 days served, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.   Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tywan R. Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Schoenfeldt.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court wittholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions consecutive to Milwaukee County case 05CF348; credit for 5 days served if revoked; pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Schoenfeldt.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 11/6/15 at 11:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Schoenfeldt.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Schoenfeldt requests to set a trial date.  JSH set for 10/15/15 at 1:15pm and JS 11/2/15 at 8:30am, ludwig hearing set for 9/11/15 at 10:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Schoenfeldt.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Schoenfeldt states he needs to review the video after he receives it.  STC continued to 8/11/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Schoenfeldt and by approval of the court, the FPT of 6/11/15 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as Atty Schoenfeldt was unable to appear on this date; reset to 7/23/15 at 1:15pm as a PLEAH.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Schoenfeldt.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Schoenfeldt needs time to get more discovery.  FPT continued to 6/11/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Schoenfeldt the FPT of 2/26/15 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as he has another matter to attend to; reset to 4/9/15 at 1:30pm.
With Atty Schoenfeldt the FPT of 1/26/15 at 1:15pm should have been 2/26/15 at 1:15pm.
Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Mark Schoenfeldt.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  At request of parties, pretrial adj. to 1/26/15 at 1:15.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Schoenfeldt.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Schoenfeldt states they are close to a resolution.  FPT continued to 1/15/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Schoenfeldt the FPT of 10/23/14 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, as he needs to discuss case w/ADA; reset to 11/13/14 at 1:30pm.
With Atty Schoenfeldt the FPT of 9/8/14 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, as he has a scheduling conflict; reset to 10/23/14 at 1:30pm.
Final pre-trial on September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: of Judge Schroeder.  Tab pulled for Branch 6 - Judge Wagner

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Mark Schoenfeldt.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:59am-  DE is present but not in proper court attire.  Court adjourns matter to October 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Attorney Schoenfeldt notified the DE of the next court date.  Bond continued.

DA Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 24, 2014 at 10:30 am.
6/10/2014 Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 7/24/2014 at 10:30am by the Court.  DA Pre-trial scheduled for 6/20/2014 at 1:30pm.  NTBS by the Court.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Mark Schoenfeldt. Clerk LE. Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-10-14 @ 2:30pm. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

Attorney Patrick Anderson appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Mark Schoenfeldt.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 4/24/14 @ 1030am.  $2500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.   *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
